author: Emily G
text: 'Good food and customer service. Fast ordering using QR code. I wish they expand their space with more outdoor seats.'

author: Jimmy Zuniga
text: 'I‚Äôm not sure what is going on with management - but why is there only one employee running the entire show? They‚Äôre the barista
column5: server
column6:
and takes the orders.

It takes 20 minutes just to grab a coffee. And when there are staff working - it takes over an hour to get food.

I‚Äôm only marking this review with 1 star so that it gets noticed - revamp your business model because this is extremely inefficient for the business and customers.'

author: Ivanna Kaleniuk
text:
'Terrible service.

author: N Busch
text: 'We only had drinks and croissants but I‚Äôve had food at the upper westside location and it was great. I so appreciate the healthy options this restaurant offers
column5: the outdoor seating was nice
column6: and once I figured out that I was supposed to order from my phone it was ok. We had a hibiscus iced tea and an americano (called something else on their menu) and croissants. The croissants were fine and would have been good with a few minutes in an oven to crisp them up. I hope to be back soon and order more food. My high rating during this particular visit was the absolute
column7: genuine warmth and kindness from our server. It was hot out and we have a big
column8: very old dog. We were surprised she made it the few blocks to the restaurant. The server brought her a big bowl of ice water and really lavished her with petting and kindness. It was so sweet. Really appreciated the warmth. Look forward to determining my favorite coffee item on their menu.'

author: Jason Lopez
text: 'Everything. Is. Amazing.'

text: 'Coffee taste bad. The time you will wait for your food is ridiculous. We order online

author: Randall Blecher
text: 'We stopped by for coffee with our pup.  Nice outdoor seating

author: Linda Vee
text: 'This was my second time eating at this restaurant. The tables outside are positioned in comfortable spots and in shady areas. Ordering food is a breeze using the QR code. Waiters were friendly and answered my questions about the menu.\n\nI had a chicken and vegetable bowl and my mother in law had the toast. We also had a mocha and iced tea. Drinks were refreshing and food was delicious. I‚Äôm looking forward to trying more items on the menu.'

author: tejaswi koganti

author: Gayatri Anguloori
text: 'Went in today to get a cold brew with oat milk. I‚Äôm not sure if the coffee or the milk was spoiled but the coffee had a spoiled sour taste and it also tasted burnt. It honestly did not even taste like a cold brew because it was so harsh and not smooth like most cold brews are; i think they gave me their iced coffee instead because it tastes burnt and sour. Staff was nice but If you want good coffee do not come here‚Äîyou‚Äôre better off going to Dunkin Donuts instead to be very honest.'

author: yasir sherza
text: "Love the food and the service. I was hoping to order the impossible burger but it wasn't on the menu. However

text: 'We found this place by strolling along the street and decided to eat outside there just as it was getting busy around 10:30-11. You can order food and pay for it by scanning a QR code on the table

'This is my first time trying their Brunch after drinking their coffee for long time.

order and pay from our phone.

text: 'This was 3 star: My boyfriend and I came here and both got the green eggs. It‚Äôs supposed to be an over easy or at least medium dish to dip the bread in the eggs. This is my first time eating here and I will try again but my first impression is less than mediocre. Also

text: 'Coffee was bitter

One person didn‚Äôt have a card to pay at all. This place tries way too hard to be cool when there are so many other better coffee shops and breakfast places in Hoboken. Not worth the time.'

text: 'Although I was skeptical at first

author: Brian Meise
text: 'First
column5: the positives. My girlfriend and I both ordered cappuccinos which were good and came out relatively quickly. We also got toast with almond butter and jam which was great.  Service then went downhill. It took forever for the waitress to come take our order. We both ordered avocado toast - I thought it was ok
column6: however
column7:
my girlfriend thought it was too oily. My avocado toast came out 5 minutes before hers and got cold while I waited - unacceptable! It then took forever for the waitress to get it check.

The two stars are for the cappuccinos and toast.

FYI - They do not accept cash.'

author: Stephanie Lanning
text: 'Great decor and loved the chai latte. Going back for breakfast tomorrow'

author: Alexandra Aroyo
text:
'WARNING do not eat here! Yes this look yummy but tasted awful. The Avo toast tasted of spoiled yogurt. Our service was horrible and really do hate complaining about stuff like this but the food was spoiled which ended up in my boyfriend having extremely severe

FOOD POISONING ü§¢

The managed Stephanie was kind enough to comp our meal but that does not excuse how sick he is.  We will not be going back. Also after trying to call the location 4 times to warn them about potentially making other customers sick no one answered.'

author: K McKay
text: 'Positive and Great customer Service'

author: Bridget Monahan
text: "The one star goes out to the avacado toast. It was in fact very yummy. But the rest of my experience this morning was why there aren't any more stars. I went to have breakfast with myself and was seated immediately. Then was ignored while the hosts/wait staff seated multiple tables and started taking those tables orders without taking mine (I was not being distracted on my phone and just forgetting to order). While I was waiting I was watching some wait staff kind of stand around or bumping into each other. Not sure if the amount of tables and how they are set up is the best use of the space with the amount of wait staff that was working that day. The menu should have the descriptions that they have online. I had never heard of magic
column5: piccolo....) and Had to look up most of the different styles of coffee they had listed. I ended up going with a long black and avocado toast. I had never had a long black but it came with a small glass of sparkling water that was cracked. I told the waiter about the glass and he went to replace it but replaced it empty.....The manager was nice enough to discount my drink.  What I wish was more advertised was that this place is a credit card/debit card payment only place. The waiter said there was a sign on the door meanwhile the door was open so that only if you approached from the left would you have seen it."

author: Andrew Stranovsky
text: 'Great coffee and healthy breakfast options.  This new location fills up quickly so get there early.  The app works perfectly for ordering.  Place is cashless so get the app set up before your first visit.'

author: Peter Praum
text: '(Translated by Google) Very good cafe that is in no way inferior to the European one !!!\nFinally a good cafe

A perfect European style coffee !!!!

author: Mango & Coast Patterns
text: 'Visited the new location in Hoboken all the way from Canada for Easter Weekend and the barista who made my drink put no effort into my beet latte
column5: no latte art as advertised on your beautiful Instagram account
column6: what a let down.'

author: Ryan Hamilton
text: 'Best coffee shop in FIDI is coming to town...Woo!'
